claim: We then visualized the journal publication frequency distribution (see Figure 1).
title: Figure 1.
caption: Histogram shows the distribution journals by the number of articles indexed by PubMed between 2009 and 2019.

claim: The distribution of journals by the frequency of indexed articles is visualized in a binned bar graph in Figure 1, with the cumulative percentage of journals plotted as a line over the bar graph.
title: Figure 1.
caption: Histogram shows the distribution journals by the number of articles indexed by PubMed between 2009 and 2019.

claim: All resulting OBMS prototype networks are visualized as interactive networks using map4sci infrastructure (see Figure 2 and https://cns-iu.github.io/obms/).
title: Figure 2.
caption: Network visualization for the open biomedical map of science (https://cns-iu.github.io/obms/visualizer).

claim: Users can also explore the map by searching for specific journal families and MeSH descriptors, such as “PLoS,” which are marked by blue pins in Figure 2.
title: Figure 2.
caption: Network visualization for the open biomedical map of science (https://cns-iu.github.io/obms/visualizer).

claim: Results of the TF-IDF analysis are ranked, filtered, and then processed by the MST Pathfinder Network Scaling algorithm, which determines the final set of edge included in prototype OBMS networks (see Figure 2).
title: Figure 2.
caption: Network visualization for the open biomedical map of science (https://cns-iu.github.io/obms/visualizer).
